item.title: OR-19 South at OR-207
item.description: OR-19 South at OR-207 in Service Creek. Use OR-207 south for Mitchell and Prineville. Use OR-19 South/OR-207 North for Spray, (John Day) Fossil (Beds) National Monument (Sheep Rock Unit), and John Day. OR-207 north joins OR-19 south to Spray.

item.title: End OR-207 North at US-730
item.description: End OR-207 North at US-730 in Umatilla County. Turn left for US-730 west to McNary Dam and Umatilla; turn right for US-730 east to Pasco (Washington) and Walla Walla (Washington).

item.title: End OR-207 North at US-730
item.description: End OR-207 North at US-730. Use OR-207 south for Hermiston and Heppner.

item.title: OR-207 North Approaching US-730
item.description: OR-207 North approaching US-730 in Umatilla County.

item.title: OR-207 North - Cold Springs Reservoir Jct.
item.description: OR-207 North at Punkin Center Road to Cold Springs Reservoir.

item.title: OR-207 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on OR-207 north. Distance to Wallula (Washington) and Walla Walla (Washington).

item.title: OR-207 North at US-395 - Hermiston
item.description: OR-207 North at US-395 in Hermiston. Turn left for US-395 north to Umatilla; continue straight for OR-207 North to Wallula (Washington). No destination is given for US-395 south.

item.title: OR-207 North Approaching US-395
item.description: OR-207 North approaching US-395 in Hermiston.

item.title: OR-207 North (NW 11th St.) at W. Elm Ave.
item.description: OR-207 North (NW 11th St.) at W. Elm Ave. in Hermiston. Turn right on Elm Ave. to continue north on OR-207.

item.title: OR-207 North (NW 11th St.) Approaching Elm St.
item.description: OR-207 North (NW 11th St.) Aapproaching Elm St. in Hermiston. Turn right on Elm St. to continue north on OR-207.

item.title: OR-207 North - Hermiston
item.description: Entering Hermiston on OR-207 north. Hermiston is the largest city in eastern Oregon.

item.title: OR-207 North - Hinkle Jct.
item.description: OR-207 North approaching Hinkle Jct.

item.title: OR-207 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on OR-207 north. Distance to Hermiston and Umatilla (via US-395).

item.title: OR-207 North at I-84/US-30 West
item.description: OR-207 North at I-84/US-30 West in Umatilla County. Use I-84/US-30 west to Portland. Continue north on OR-207 for Hermiston, McNary Dam, and Umatilla Bridge.

item.title: OR-207 North at I-84/US-30 East
item.description: OR-207 North at I-84/US-30 East. Use I-84/US-30 East to Pendleton; continue north on OR-207 for Hermiston and Boardman (via I-84/US-30 West).

item.title: OR-207 North Approaching I-84/US-30
item.description: OR-207 North approaching I-84/US-30 (Exit 182) in Umatilla County.

item.title: OR-207 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on OR-207 north to I-84 Freeway and Hermiston.

item.title: OR-207 North at Echo Jct.
item.description: OR-207 North at Echo Jct. Turn right for Echo and Pendleton, and to continue north on the Lexington-Echo Highway #320. Continue north on OR-207 for I-84 Freeway and Hermiston. OR-207 northbound becomes the Hermiston Highway #333.

item.title: OR-207 North Approaching Echo Jct.
item.description: OR-207 North approaching Echo Jct.

item.title: OR-207 North - Umatilla County
item.description: Entering Umatilla County on OR-207 north.

item.title: OR-207 North at Butler Creek Road
item.description: OR-207 North at Butler Creek Road in Morrow County. Continue north on OR-207 for Echo, Hermiston, and Pendleton.

item.title: OR-207 North Approaching Boardman Jct.
item.description: OR-207 North approaching Boardman Jct (Bombing Range Road).

item.title: OR-207 North at Baseline Lane
item.description: OR-207 North at Baseline Lane/Juniper Canyon Road.

item.title: OR-207 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on OR-207 north. Distance to Boardman, Echo, and Hermiston.

item.title: OR-74 West/OR-207 North at OR-74/OR-207 Split in Lexington
item.description: OR-74/OR-207 North at OR-74/OR-207 split in Lexington. Turn right on OR-207 North to Boardman, Hermiston, and Pendleton. Continue straight for OR-74 West to Ione and Arlington.

item.title: OR-74/OR-207 North - Lexington
item.description: Entering Lexington on OR-74/OR-207 North.

item.title: OR-206 East/OR-207 North Approaching OR-74
item.description: OR-206 East/OR-207 North approaching OR-74 in Heppner.

item.title: OR-207 North/OR-206 East - Heppner
item.description: Entering Heppner on OR-207 North/OR-206 East. Heppner is the county seat of Morrow County, Oregon.

item.title: OR-206 East/OR-207 North - Morrow County
item.description: OR-206 East/OR-207 North in Morrow County.

item.title: OR-207 North at OR-206
item.description: OR-207 North at OR-206 in Ruggs. Turn left for OR-206 West to Condon; turn right for OR-206 East/OR-207 North to Heppner. OR-207 joins OR-206 east to Heppner.

item.title: OR-207 North Approaching OR-206
item.description: OR-207 North approaching OR-206 in Morrow County.

item.title: OR-207 North - Milepost
item.description: Milepost on OR-207 north - Mile 2C. Milepost 90 (B) on US-395 south. The C is because the state of Oregon maintains different internal highways along the state highway system. Some of the signed highways (like OR-207) span multiple internal highways. In this case this is the third internal highway south from the beginning of OR-207 at US-730 that belongs only to OR-207. The first (Hermiston Highway #333) is marked as an A on mileposts.

item.title: OR-207 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on OR-207 north. Distance to Heppner.

item.title: OR-207 North - Hardman
item.description: Entering the community of Hardman on OR-207 north. Hardman is a ghost town in Morrow County.

item.title: OR-207 North - Summit
item.description: Summit on OR-207 north - Elevation 4612 Feet.

item.title: OR-207 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on OR-207 north. Distance to Hardman and Heppner.

item.title: OR-19 North at OR-207 North
item.description: OR-19 North at OR-207 north near Spray. Use OR-207 north to Hardman and Heppner. Continue north on OR-19 and south on OR-207 to Spray and Fossil. OR-207 south joins OR-19 north to Service Creek.

item.title: OR-19 North Approaching OR-207
item.description: OR-19 North approaching OR-207 north to Hardman and Heppner.

item.title: OR-19 South/OR-207 North at OR-19/OR-207 Split
item.description: OR-19 South/OR-207 North at OR-19/OR-207 split. Use OR-207 North for Heppner and Hardman. Continue south on OR-19 for Kimberly, (John Day) Fossil Beds National Monument and John Day.

item.title: OR-19 South/OR-207 North Approaching OR-19/OR-207 Split
item.description: OR-19 South/OR-207 North approaching OR-19/OR-207 split. Use OR-207 North for Hardman and Heppner.

item.title: OR-19 South/OR-207 North - Spray
item.description: Entering Spray on OR-19 South/OR-207 North.

item.title: OR-19 South/OR-207 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance Marker on OR-19 South/OR-207 North. Distance to Spray, Heppner (via OR-207) and John Day (via OR-19).

item.title: OR-19 South at OR-207
item.description: OR-19 South at OR-207 in Service Creek. Use OR-207 south for Mitchell and Prineville. Use OR-19 South/OR-207 North for Spray, (John Day) Fossil (Beds) National Monument (Sheep Rock Unit), and John Day. OR-207 north joins OR-19 south to Spray.

item.title: OR-19 South Approaching OR-207 - Service Creek
item.description: OR-19 South Approaching OR-207 in Service Creek,

item.title: I-84/US-30 West - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance Marker on I-84/US-30 West in Stanfield. Distance to OR 207, The Dalles, and Portland.

item.description: US-395 south at OR-207 in Hermiston.

item.title: US-395 South Approaching OR-207
item.description: US-395 South approaching OR-207 in Hermiston. Use OR-207 south for Heppner; OR-207 north for Walla Walla (Washington).

item.title: US-395 South Approaching OR-207
item.description: US-395 South approaching OR-207 in Hermiston.

item.title: OR-74 East/OR-207 South at OR-206
item.description: OR-74 East/OR-207 South at OR-206 in Heppner. Turn left to continue east on OR-74 to Fairgrounds, Pilot Rock, and Pendleton. Continue straight for OR-206/OR-207 South to Condon and Spray. Use OR-206/OR-207 for the Blue Mountain Scenic Byway.

item.title: OR-74 East/OR-207 South - Lexington
item.description: OR-74 East/OR-207 South in Lexington, Oregon.

item.title: OR-74 East at OR-207
item.description: OR-74 East at OR-207. Turn left for OR-207 north to Boardman, Hermiston, and Pendleton. Continue straight for OR-74 East/OR-207 South to Heppner.

item.title: OR-74 South Approaching OR-207
item.description: OR-74 South Approaching OR-207 in Lexington.

item.title: OR-206 West/OR-207 West at Split
item.description: OR-206 West/OR-207 West at OR-206/OR-207 split. Turn right for OR-206 west to Condon. Turn left for OR-207 west to Hardman and Spray.

item.title: Distance Marker on OR-206/OR-207
item.description: Distance marker on OR-206 West/OR-207 South to Condon and Spray.

item.title: OR-74 North at OR-206/OR-207
item.description: OR-74 north at OR-206 and OR-207 in Heppner. Turn right to continue north on OR-74 North and OR-207 North to Lexington, Ione, and Arlington. Turn left on Main St. for OR-207 south and OR-206 west to Condon and Spray.

item.description: I-84 west at Exit 182, OR-207/Hermiston/Lexington.

item.title: US-26 East approaching OR-207
item.description: US-26 approaching OR-207 north to Spray, Service Creek, and Fossil, 1/2 mile.

item.title: I-84 at Exit 182 - OR-207 Jct.
item.description: I-84 Exit 182 offramp at OR-207. Use OR-207 north to Hermiston, McNary Dam, and Umatilla Bridge. Use US-207 south to Lexington.
